text: thumb Jean-Yves Bony (born 11 March 1955) is a French farmer and politician of the Republicans. ==Political career== Bony has been mayor of the commune of Ally in the Cantal department since March 2001 and vice-president of the Communauté de communes du Pays de Salers, created in 2004. He is also president of the Ally/Escorailles/Brageac Syndicat des Eaux (water company) and president of the retirement home of Ally. A general councillor in Cantal, representing the Canton de Pleaux, he was the eighth vice-president of the Cantal General Council. A Suppléant of Alain Marleix at the general election in June 2007, Bony became deputy of the 2nd circonscription of Cantal when the latter became Secretary of State for Veterans on 19 June 2007 in the second government of François Fillon. Marleix was re-elected in 2012.Assemblée nationale: M. Alain Marleix In parliament, Bony serves on the Committee on Sustainable Development and Spatial Planning. In addition to his committee assignments, he is part of the French-Cuban Parliamentary Friendship Group.Jean-Yves Bony French National Assembly. ==Political positions== In the Republicans’ 2017 leadership election, Bony endorsed Laurent Wauquiez.Ludovic Vigogne (October 11, 2017), La liste des 136 parrains de Laurent Wauquiez L'Opinion. == References == Category:1955 births Category:Living people Category:Deputies of the 15th National Assembly of the French Fifth Republic Category:Union for a Popular Movement politicians Category:The Republicans (France) politicians Category:Departmental councilors (France)
